intro: Ctenosperma alpinum, commonly known as the alpine ctenosperma, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
